channel.title: Hosting on a wireless network
channel.description: Since I have gotten a new laptop and I have about 1.2Mb/s of wireless connection speed, I want to host on my machine. I have tried but it doesn't use my IP. It uses my routers. Is there any way to use wireless to host a website/server?

item.title: Hosting on a wireless network
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Just an example, as more than likely this will not be the same for you:

wvwoyq.png540×622

As you can see in the images, to set a Dynamic IP in the router, I must click “reserve” (takes me clicking another button above that section as well, but thats not important. Check for your IP in the router, and see whats going on.

P.S - The blank hostname connected, is my Xbox. Felt the need to say, before people tell me someone is steeling my internet.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting on a wireless network
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

yeah im pretty sure it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting on a wireless network
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“hat trix, post:7, topic:330842”]im having his same problem, im 99.9% sure im port forwarded right, and just incase i followed the tut on making my .bat auto port forward, and that says its working, i set up a no-ip, and the ip duc says its working, but i try to connect it says “error connecting to server” when i run my server it says
“automatically port forwarding…
automatic port forward complete.
Starting server on 0.0.0.0:43594”
i can connect with 127.0.0.1
but my ip, and my no-ip doesnt work

o and its on my exceptions list on my firewall[/quote]
TIP: I tried that tut, and un-did working port-forwards with my router, and it didn’t work. It doesn’t work with all routers.

@TOPIC - You have a dynamic IP in the router right?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting on a wireless network
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

im having his same problem, im 99.9% sure im port forwarded right, and just incase i followed the tut on making my .bat auto port forward, and that says its working, i set up a no-ip, and the ip duc says its working, but i try to connect it says “error connecting to server” when i run my server it says
“automatically port forwarding…
automatic port forward complete.
Starting server on 0.0.0.0:43594”
i can connect with 127.0.0.1
but my ip, and my no-ip doesnt work

o and its on my exceptions list on my firewall

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting on a wireless network
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

That or you’re not using the right IP. www.ipchicken.com.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting on a wireless network
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If it isn’t working then you haven’t done it correctly.

edit: To clarify, routers don’t care whether you are connected to them wirelessly or with a wire, it is all the same to them.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting on a wireless network
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

I have port forwarded already.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting on a wireless network
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Stupit:

Since I have gotten a new laptop and I have about 1.2Mb/s of wireless connection speed, I want to host on my machine. I have tried but it doesn’t use my IP. It uses my routers. Is there any way to use wireless to host a website/server?

Same way you do it with a wire, port forwarding.

Read full topic
